reference.text: positive-displacement engines for liquid F03C; machines for liquids and gases F01; positive-displacement machines for liquids F04 , rotary fluid gearing of the hydrokinetic type F16H41/00

note.note-paragraph: Attention is drawn to the notes preceding Class F01, especially as regards the definition of "reaction type".

This subclass comprises:
- engines, other than of positive-displacement type, driven by
liquids;
- machines, other than of positive-displacement type, for
liquids.

title-part.text: Non-positive-displacement machines or engines characterised by specified type, e.g. water turbines

reference.text: adaptations of machines or engines for special use F03B13/00; controlling F03B15/00

title-part.text: Engines of impulse type, i.e. turbines with jets of high-velocity liquid impinging on blades or like rotors, e.g. Pelton wheels
Machines or engines of reaction type
with radial flow at high-pressure side and axial flow at low-pressure side of rotors, e.g. Francis turbines
with substantially axial flow throughout rotors, e.g. propeller turbines
with adjustable blades, e.g. Kaplan turbines
with pressure-velocity transformation exclusively in rotors
characterised by having means for functioning alternatively as pumps or turbines

CPC-specific-text.text: the same wheel acting as turbine wheel and as pump wheel
the turbine wheel and the pumps wheel being mounted in adjacent positions on the same shaft in a single casing
specially designed as adjustable blades, e.g. for Kaplan-type turbines
Rotors for radial flow at high-pressure side and axial flow at low-pressure side, e.g. for Francis-type turbines
Rotors for essentially axial flow, e.g. for propeller turbines

reference.text: if the regulation aspect is preponderent, see F03B15/00 and subgroups

title-part.text: Guide conduits or vanes, e.g. adjustable

CPC-specific-text.text: Conduits in dams or the like F03B13/08; arrangement of valves F03B11/004

title-part.text: Machines or engines characterised by non-bladed rotors, e.g. serrated, using friction
Parts or details not provided for in, or of interest apart from, the preceding groups

CPC-specific-text.text: e.g. wear-protection couplings, between turbine and generator

reference.text: F03B3/10 takes precedence; adjustable wicket gates F03B3/183; valves in general F16K

title-part.text: for diminishing cavitation or vibration, e.g. balancing
for removing foreign matter, e.g. mud
Adaptations of machines or engines for special use
Combinations of machines or engines with driving or driven apparatus

incorporating only machines or engines of positive-displacement type F03C; hydraulic engineering aspects E02B;

CPC-specific-text.text: combinations with wind energy converters F03D9/008
for driving tools or the like having relatively small outer diameter, e.g. pipe cleaning tools

title-part.text: Stations or aggregates of water-storage type,

CPC-specific-text.text: e.g. comprising a turbine and a pump

reference.text: siphon weirs E02B7/18; siphons in general F04F10/00

title-part.text: Submerged units incorporating electric generators or motors
characterised by using wave or tide energy

CPC-specific-text.text: which creates an oscillating water column
which lifts water above sea level
for inmediate use in an energy converter
using the static pressure increase due to the wave

title-part.text: using the relative movement between a wave-operated member,
is fixed, at least at one point, with respect to the sea bed or shore

CPC-specific-text.text: and the wom is hinged to the rem
and the wom slides relative to the rem
where the connection between wom and conversion system takes tension and compression
the connection being of the rack-and-pinion type
where the connection between wom and conversion system takes tension only
and the wom directly actuates the piston of a pump
and the wom is the piston or the cylinder in a pump
and the wom is flexible or deformable
and the wom is tied to the rem
acting directly on the piston of a pump
where the tie is a tension/compression member

title-part.text: are movable relative to the sea bed or shore
using the flow of water resulting from wave movements to drive a motor or turbine
to produce a flow of air, e.g. to drive an air turbine

CPC-specific-text.text: using the relative movement between a tide-operated member and another member
using the horizontal flow of water resulting from tide movement
regulation of plants characterised by the use of siphons F03B13/086

CPC-specific-text.text: with rotation axis substantially in flow direction
with rotation axis substantially at right angle to flow direction
the flow engaging parts having no movement relative to the rotor during its rotation
and a rotor of the endless-chain type
the flow engaging parts having a cyclic movement relative to the rotor during its rotation
and a rotor of the endless-chain type
